data.title: The Third Degree
data.text: A very expansive contemporary museum on the campus on the UW-Madison that is centrally located, with Van Galder Coach Lines and Badger Bus that stop right in front (for same day travelers). The multiples displays are houses within a cubist post-modern multi-level interior which is easy to navigate and stroll through. Classic Greek artifacts highlight the breath and scope of the collection(s).

data.title: Wonderful Art Museum on University of wisconsin campus
data.text: If you enjoy art, this is a must stop on a visit to the University of wiscon or to Madison. There are two connected buildings which themselves are very interesting. The collection is quite eclectic. allow a couple of hours. Admission is free.

data.title: Meander through all kinds of art
data.text: This art museum is a hidden gem.  Don't go when you're in a hurry.  There are also benches to rest throughout.

data.title: Worth a visit
data.text: I was surprised by the breadth of the collection at this museum. It is a jewel in Madison.  They offer docent tours every afternoon

data.title: Too big to see it all
data.text: Give yourself more than 2 hours. Free! Donations gladly accepted. Three stories of diverse art, history and interesting statues, dishes, pottery.  There is often an artist in residence to learn from. Beautiful building, great part of town. Wisconsin artists are represented, but there are treasures from all over the planet.

data.title: Eclectic
data.text: An excellent museum in the Campus of the University. A varied collection in a rambling captivating bulding. Rothko, Miró, Warhol but classical paintings from medieval european artists. Modern and antique sculptures, etc.

data.title: Very nice facility, gallery layout, and collection!
data.text:
Ok, so this isn't the Louvre, and as a consequence they do not have a large amount of well known artists in their displays,,,, but what they did have was very interesting, sometimes provocative, but above all well rounded in style and period representation. 
Spent about 5 hours there to see every gallery and really enjoyed my day. I would recommend it for sure. Be prepared to struggle to find parking if you go while classes are in session at the University. Nearby ramps were full, had to park quite some distance away.

data.title: Wonderful space and collection...must see...must use Internet Explorer Browser to view web site
data.text: Madison is so fortunate to have this museum. The collections and the space are wonderful. We have especially enjoyed seeing the 10'x13' mural by Mr Ikeda progress over the last 2 years.

data.title: Beautiful selection of art
data.text: Lovely museum on campus at University of Wisconsin in Madison.  Wonderful halls with beautiful selection of art and often very well done temporary exhibits as well.

data.title: Art Excellence
data.text: This is a very nice art museum with a large enough collection to interest anyone. You probably need to spend at least a couple of hours there.

data.title: great place for a free view of art
data.text: interesting museum in Madison. Lots of wings and somewhat difficult to navigate. a wide variety of art and the admission price is $0.00. So few a few dollars for parking allows you to see a wide scope of art.

data.title: Another freebie
data.text: This is a nice museum, well worth a few hours. They have an eclectic mix - a bit of everything. Amazingly enough, no admission but make sure you donate.

data.title: Nice collection (especially contemporary works) and it's free!
data.text: Spent an hour or so wandering the galleries and really enjoyed the eclectic collection.  And, it's a lovely building,too.  Best of all: no charge!

data.title: Love!
data.text: What a cool place. I love the expansion that they did a number of years ago. I always get inspired when I go there and really every time I visit I leave happy. Some of the art like the kissing goats, one of my faves, just made me burst out laughing seeing it in person. I'm not sure if that's what the artist intended me to do but I like things that make me laugh. Other art makes me feel different and I like that too. What an interesting place when it brings on a lot of differing emotions.

data.title: An extensive collection, and it's free
data.text: The Chazen is the university's art museum and it is well endowed. It has an extensive collection and recently doubled its space so more can be shown at any one time. It also has several spaces for special exhibits. Since it's free, it's the sort of place I like to go to and just visit one room at a time.

data.title: Wonderful!!!!!
data.text: I spent one hour and a half there still didn't finish watching all the exhibits!!! This is a wonderful place with so many amazing masterworks!!!! It's much bigger than I thought and it definitely worth a visit. Plus Admission is free!!!

data.title: Great if you like modern and contemporary art
data.text:
Curators and donors have a taste for unusual art. Salvatore Dali came to my mind several times when viewing the collection.

Try to find the gorgeous view of Lake Mendota from the floor-to-ceiling glass windows in the hallway connecting two wings of the museum.

If coming by car, the Lake Street indoor parking garage was less than a block from the museum.

Before or after your museum visit, weather permitting, walk towards Lake Mendota (2-3 blocks?) and enjoy the view from Union Terrace.

This museum is much bigger than I expected. On our way out, I realized that we only saw a fraction of the museum, since there are other wings and other floors.

data.title: Beautiful Art, Quite.
data.text: Beautiful artwork and rotating exhibits make this a great option for a rainy afternoon or a snowy day!

data.title: Enjoyable afternoon at the museum
data.text: We visited Madison during a heat wave. What better way to spend the hot afternoon but in the Chazen Museum.  The museum is right on the University campus.  The museum was cool and comfortable. We spent several hours there as there was so much to see with such an eclectic collection.  There was Flemish paintings and modern art.  We hadn't realized that there was a new and older part of the museum.  My favorite was the glass/craft exhibit on the top floor.

data.title: Interesting for a person with no clues in Art
data.text: I am not an Art enthusiast and I will declare I honestly really do not know the subject. Nevertheless, I have found it interesting just to wander around and look at the various pieces of work, even without a full appreciation or understanding of it. Some works set me off thinking what is this about? Why is it supposed to mean? I never knew the answers but nevetherless enjoyed it.
